name: Carl Magnus Appelberg
obverse: Bust of Carl Magnus Appelberg facing right.
reverse: Two young angels facing each other and holding a wreath above their heads. The angel on the left is holding grapes. The angel on the right is holding a lyre. Between the two angels is a shield divided into three parts: the top part has a lyre, the bottom left part has a chalice, the bottom right part has a book.
reverse_inscriptions: HÆC ME TRIA * DE LEC TANT
description: Carl Magnus Appelberg was born November 16, 1826 in Gothenburg, Sweden and died April 10, 1896 in Linköping, Sweden. Appelberg was a doctor and founder of Samfundet SHT.
